instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is 3V3_S0SW_LCD? 3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state that powers the LCD screen image circuitry. This is necessary to get an image on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No video
threads.message:
Hello
I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017, no liquid found, overall good condition but super dusty.
The macbook wont show anything on the screen, if I disconnect the screen I get external video. 

I do not have a screen to test, are there any measurement that I can check so I can order the screen with [U]a little more[/U] confidence? 

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No video
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>.
Also check diode mode readings on <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines; compare with good board, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No video
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL>: 3.29V
<SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>: Couldnt measure it since the resistor is just under the video cable shield.

I will order, the screen. Thanks!
